intro: Calycolpus schomburgkianus var. recurvatus, commonly known as the recurved calycolpus, is a tropical plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, recurved leaflets. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, drupe that turns red when mature, often containing a single seed.
